odysseus.common.entities

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • odysseus.common.entities.Square
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReleaseSquare

    public class Square
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Square defines the basic behavior of a square. The square is crafted of a type and location. The method playable() returns true if the type of square can be played upon by another square; false if it can not be played upon. The types of square are: null empty filled hint release.
    Author:
    Carlos Barcelos, Michelle Gagnon, Andre Imperiali, Justin Myerson, Kevin Valente
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • playable

        public boolean playable()
        Returns the playable status, i.e. whether or not another square can be played above this one.
        Returns:
        false - Squares are inherently not playable.
